trial_identification.studytitle: Diagnosis of Interstitial Cystitis in Women with Pelvic Pain
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Diagnosis of Interstitial Cystitis in Women with Chronic Pelvic Pain - a Prospective Observational Study

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Conditions of unknown or disputed aetiology (such as chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis)

interventions.interventions: Cystoscopy (+/- bladder biopsy) and questionaires to diagnose Interstitial Cystitis. Questionaires include details on demographics, pelvic pain symptoms with visual analogue scales to rate severity, urinary symptoms with Pelvic Pain and Urgency/Frequency (PUF) and O'Leary-Sant Symptom Index and Problem Index questionaires. These questionaires are given to participant at recruitment preoperatively. The duration of observation is from recruitment to the completion of the operation with or without biopsy results. There are no follow up questionaires planned at this stage.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of interstitial cystitis diagnosed in women with chronic pelvic pain.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the conclusion of the study

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of bladder pain syndrome diagnosied in women with chronic pelvic pain
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the conclusion of the study

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 18-50 years old Females Presence of Pelvic pain for more than 6 months Cause of pain unknown (except for past history of endometriosis or interstitial cystitis) A laparoscopy is planned as part of the investigation of pelvic pain
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Does not consent Non English Speaking under 18 years old or over 50 years old Presence of urinary tract infection Likely cause (except history of endometriosis or interstitial cystitis) of pelvic pain known, such as ovarian cysts, hydrosalpinx etc.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Royal Women's Hospital Grattan Street Victoria

fundingsource.fundingname: Australasian Gynaecological Endoscopy & Surgery Research Fund

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Prospective Observational study looking at the diagnosis of interstitial cystitis in women with chronic pelvic pain. Women who are booked for a laparoscopy as part of their investigation for chronic pelvic pain are recruited. Questionaires on demographics, pelvic pain symptoms and urinary symptoms are given and cystoscopy added to the procedure if not already planned for. Findings at cystoscopy such as glomerulation and Huner's ulcer, and at laparoscopy such as endometriosis and its stage, are recorded. Outcomes of proportion of these women with interstitial cystitis will be looked at. Comparison will also be made of the presenting symptoms between the groups of women who have interstitial cystitis alone; endometriosis alone,;both and neither conditions.
